pr_title: Use ValueFetcher when loading text snippets to highlight

timeline.message: Use ValueFetcher when loading text snippets to highlight

timeline.bodyText: null looks is going to cause this to fail on runtime fields. Do we filter those out other places?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I meant to highlight this with a comment of 'not sure about this' - I'm pretty sure that we filter out non-text fields further up the stack, but I need to double-check.
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: I think we do try to highlight runtime fields. I'm not sure how we manage not to fail here. Runtime fields really need the SearchLookup to do anything.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I vaguely remember looking at this too, and finding that for runtime fields we simply don't return anything highlighted rather than failing, as they are not in _source nor stored.
replies.author: javanna

replies.bodyText: Given that runtime fields can't be highlighted anyway, I just added a null check for SearchLookup inside the value fetcher in AbstractScriptFieldType.
replies.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: Dropping this is a behavior change - this behavior of defaulting to stored fields was something folks were really keen on historically.
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Is this something that we can build into the ValueFetchers themselves? If it's a performance enhancement here, then it presumably will be elsewhere as well?
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText:
Is this something that we can build into the ValueFetchers themselves? If it's a performance enhancement here, then it presumably will be elsewhere as well?

It'd be super nice to have one way to think about this. So, hopefully!
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: +1 to explore automatically loading stored fields when they're available. Beyond highlighting, this would simplify some field retrieval workflows where users currently need to request both _source and stored_fields. This seems like it'd be a bigger change, maybe it'd make sense as a follow-up issue or PR ?
replies.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: I think that using stored fields if they exist is kind of a blocker for this change, or, at least, for the part of this change that drops the stored fields stuff.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think we want to make that change first.  The tricky part will be communicating to the SourceLookup (or whatever stored-fields equivalent we come up with) which fields we want to load up-front.  I wonder what the cost of just automatically reading all stored fields in the Visitor would be?
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Could we just restore the conditional if (forceSource == false && fieldType.isStored()) { ...  here in order not to block this change on a larger one around stored fields ?
replies.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: I think that means we need to add back in the 'ignoreAbove' logic, which was the main reason I tried this out.
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: I don't think so, because stored fields already respect the ignore_above option for keywords, so they'll be naturally excluded.
replies.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: That was the crux that I was missing, thank you!  Have pushed an update
replies.author: romseygeek

timeline.message: test for copy_to highlighting; check *all* source paths

timeline.bodyText: This was a bug - if the first of multiple source paths didn't have any values, we returned early instead of continuing to check further paths.
timeline.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Thank you for catching this! Maybe we could fix this in a separate PR (with a quick test) to keep this one scoped to highlighting?
replies.author: jtibshirani

timeline.bodyText: Another option here would be to pass the Fetch-phase search lookup through all the highlighting code to HighlightUtils.loadValues(), and I think we probably will want to do that eventually, but it's not really ready yet given our uncertainty around how that lookup is built and passed around anyway.
timeline.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: I was going to ask why it is null, the supplier could throw unsupported operation exception and not be null, but it is no supplier in this case. I am not liking that much that it can be null, but I am not sure how we can avoid that in this scenario.
replies.author: javanna

timeline.bodyText: To me it'd be best to keep the original forceSource name and value -- it matches the  force_source REST option that this value comes and avoids having mixed concepts in the code.
timeline.author: jtibshirani

timeline.bodyText: I just opened #65292 -- if we like the direction and it gets merged, then MappedFieldType#valueFetcher won't need a dedicated SearchLookup at all. I think highlighting on runtime fields would 'just work' here (although it'd be worth a test!)
timeline.author: jtibshirani
